title: Body Contouring
subHeading: Hello Clear Skin. |  Hello Skin Glow. | Hello Youthful Appearance.
desc: Contour, restore volume, and give a natural-looking fullness to your body.
howItWorks: Body fillers are substances that are injected beneath the skin to add volume, enhance contours, and improve the overall appearance of specific areas of the body. The filler material is injected beneath the skin to fill in hollow areas, creases, or depressions, resulting in a smoother and more youthful appearance. Many body fillers contain hyaluronic acid (HA), a naturally occurring substance in the body that attracts and retains moisture. Body fillers with a thicker consistency can provide structural support and lift to sagging or drooping areas. They help reposition tissues, restore contours, and create a more youthful appearance.
whyWeLoveIt: Body fillers offer several advantages and benefits, making them a popular choice for individuals seeking aesthetic enhancements. Body fillers provide a non-surgical alternative to invasive procedures such as surgery or implants. They allow individuals to enhance their appearance without the need for incisions, general anaesthesia, or prolonged recovery periods. This appeals to those who prefer non-invasive or minimally invasive options.

tips.txt: If you wear makeup to your appointment, we'll need to remove it before your treatment in order to get a clean canvas..
Bring a friend! If your friend is a first time client at IV Wellness Lounge, you'll both be eligible to receive special pricing.
If taken pre-treatment, arnica and bromelain can help reduce post-treatment swelling and bruising. You can also take Tylenol.
Avoid alcoholic beverages the night before your appointment. It can make skin more susceptible to bruising.
It's best to avoid aspirin and NSAIDs (Advil, Motrin, Aleve) for a week before your treatment to help reduce bruising.
You are not a candidate for these injections if you are pregnant or breastfeeding.
Cold packs are your friend. Use them liberally for 8 hours after your treatment to help reduce swelling.
Arnica gel helps reduce bruising. You can start using it 30 minutes after your service – just apply it gently to the treated area.
Avoid exercise for 24 hours after your treatment. And facials are a no-go for at least 2 weeks.
It’s important to stay hydrated! Be sure to drink plenty of water after your treatment.
Avoid alcohol and salty foods – two culprits that contribute to swelling.
You may lie down after fillers, but please avoid laying on your face (even the sides of your face).

resultTxt: You can expect an overall improvement of the texture and tone of the skin, tightening, and increased reflectivity of light.

faq.question: Can I keep my makeup on?
faq.answer: Your skin should be clean for treatment so we can properly assess your skin and determine where to make injections. If you wear makeup to your appointment, we’ll remove it before your service. Post-treatment, we don't advise reapplying makeup immediately following, as you should avoid touching your face as much as possible for the next 24 hours.

faq.question: What must I absolutely avoid after my treatment?
faq.answer: After your treatment: No lying down for 4 hours; no exercise/working out for 24 hours; no facials for 2 weeks. Try not to touch the area excessively for the first 24 hours, except to apply arnica gel. Avoid salty foods and alcoholic beverages as they can contribute to swelling.

faq.question: How long until I see the results?
faq.answer: You'll start to see results almost immediately and can expect to see full results in about 2 weeks.

faq.question: How long do the results last?
faq.answer: Everyone's different, but typically results last anywhere from 6-18 months. It really depends on the filler we use and your aesthetic goals.

faq.question: What is the downtime? Can I go back to work?
faq.answer: We use a topical anesthetic before making injections to help minimize any discomfort during the treatment. We also use an ice pack before and after. You can also take Tylenol before and after to help reduce any pain. You may experience bruising and swelling, which can take 1-2 weeks to go away. Therefore, we don't recommend scheduling your appointment right before a big event.

faq.question: Can I receive dermal fillers while pregnant or nursing?
faq.answer: No, dermal fillers are not recommended while pregnant or nursing.

faq.question: What brand of fillers do you offer?
faq.answer: We offer a variety of high-quality fillers tailored to your specific aesthetic goals. Your provider will discuss the options during your consultation.
